title: Enter the Tello
text:
This is the first post in a Quarto blog. Welcome!

Since this post doesn’t specify an explicit image, the first image in the post will be used in the listing page of posts.

title: Post With Code
text: This is a post with executable code.

title: Enter the Tello
text: “Combine the stuff you like” is good advice when looking for a new project to work on. I like to follow good advice and so I brainstormed a bit with ChatGPT to find interesting intersections between my interests. Some of my favorite activities - like sex, meditation, and reading - were not very suitable here. Others had more potential: hiking in nature, coding, learning about new tech.

title: Enter the Tello
text: “Combine the stuff you like” is good advice when looking for a new project to work on. I like to follow good advice and so I brainstormed a bit with ChatGPT to find interesting intersections between my interests. Some of my favorite activities - like sex, meditation, and reading - were not very suitable here. Others had more potential: hiking in nature, coding, learning about new tech.

title: Enter the Tello
text:
Autonomous scouting drone
Having a drone accompany us on hikes to do some scouting ahead hits the mark for me. It includes hiking and coding, and most important: I need to learn a lot to make a drone do what I want. I have zero experience with drones and very limited experience with computer vision models.

title: Enter the Tello
text:
Getting ready big time
Like your typical tech nerd I decided to get ready for my new project in style:

Buy a domain name (most important!)
Get a logo (as important!)
Buy the best dev/DIY drone out there
Buy a top line PC to train models
Buy another PC to run simulation environments

OK, I’m guilty, I bought the domain name (hello dronelab.dev), but stopped myself there 1 2. I don’t know anything about drones, and might get bored with the project after a couple of weeks, so better start small.

title: Enter the Tello
text:
Enter the Tello
I found an old (2018 3) little drone that was perfect for my first steps, the DJI Tello! It can fly indoors, is programmable and has a camera.
There is an even better version of it with some extra goodies that might come in handy:

an onboard processor
a matrix display
a distance sensor

So I bought the DJI RoboMaster TT. TT stands for Tello Talent, which refers to very smart kids coding drones at an age I was still coloring books.
Look at that beauty!



DJI RoboMaster TT

title: Enter the Tello
text:
Footnotes


I always buy the domain first, even before I know what I’m doing.↩︎
I didn’t really stop myself there, I also created a logo. Technically ChatGPT did: ↩︎
2018, also the last time I blogged something: decentralized.blog.↩︎

title: Enter the Tello
text:
What’s next?
In the next episode I will play with the RoboMaster TT, both with and without code to control it. It includes different ways to crash it. Read on….

title: Crash the Tello (with and without code)
text:
These blog posts are intended to be read in order. If you want to follow along on my journey, start here: Enter the Tello. Or ignore this and keep on reading below.
Coming soon… (and yes, the Tello did crash, and no, the image is not real)
